comment: Would not recommend to anyone. This class was very difficult, Carlos is very rude, hates his wife (and won't stop talking about it), and grades super harsh. There is no extra credit and although I did well in the class I lost a lot of sleep over it. His guidelines are ridiculous and compared to my friend's chem labs this was so much worse!

If you care about your mental health, DO NOT take this man. He is a very tough grader and doesn't understand the concept of empathy AT ALL. Even if your family member is in the hospital or your family got evicted (which happened to me) that man does not care. I wish that I had come on here and looked up reviews, because I would NOT have taken him.

missed the 1 excused absence-sick. Next week, almost got sh0t the night before 8am lab, had a multi-hour panic attack, emailed him about what happened. Instead of responding to my email telling him I almost got sh0t, he put zeroes in for all my assignments from that week and when sick, dropped my grade from an A to 44! had to withdraw. DO NOT TAKE.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: For me, Hidalgo was able to explain topics very well through working out problems. If I didn't understand it in lecture he was able to help me understand. He can be kind of uptight about the lab reports and with questions you either get it or you don't. But once you understand what he wants, it's easy to complete.

He's fine. Makes almost every lab report harder than it should be, takes off points for very nitpicky reasons. Incredibly unforgiving, will kick people out of his class for not having the notebook filled out. If you follow his rules and pay attention, you'll do fine. If there's no other choice, take him. Otherwise, save yourself the trouble.
very tough grader but as long as you stay on top of stuff and do all your work you should be fine, he makes it very clear that you have made a mistake and will let everyone in the class know.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: I had Prof Carlos for my first science lab last semester and he made the experience very clear. He is a stickler for grading and rules, but not to the extent that it is unreasonable. You Must be dressed properly and have done your pre-lab work. He grades tough, but not so tough that it isn't completely doable to get an A pretty easily in his class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: He will happily send you out of the class that you paid for before helping with the issue at hand, has no interest in communication, horrible teacher, avoid if possible

Hidalgo is very "by the book" when it comes to lab. He's a full-time chemist elsewhere, so if you have questions about lab, work on your lab report asap after lab to receive an answer in time for next lab. Have your lab notebook PREPARED and understand lab conduct to avoid being sent home. Love the guy, though strict.

I loved having Prof Hidalgo and you will too AS LONG AS you complete your notebook thoroughly, make sure you fully understand the lab, dress appropriately, and don't try to bs. He's a pretty straight forward professor. Always down to help if you need clarification on something. He will NOT open any late assignments! A few grades get dropped btw.

I came late due to health matters one time and with a spiral notebook instead of comp and I got sent home and couldn't do the lab. He is not gracious at all and I would look for another professor because if you can't turn in something for any reason (important or not) he DOES not care you will get ZERO. NO MAKEUPS
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Intentionally trying to get people to fail and drop. He would grade correct things wrong and when pointed out will deny it. The one time the class did well on an assignment he revoked it and nobody had that kept in their grade book. About two-thirds of the class dropped in total. Wait another semester to take a different professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Typical labs you'd expect. Very strict grader but is flexible with genuine submission mistakes. DO THE PRELAB AND READ THE INSTRUCTIONS. Friendly and respectable.

I loved getting to know him after class when asking questions, he is genuinely a nice guy. I took him my first semester (fall 2019). He cares about his students even though he seems harsh. Just don't be stupid and actually care, and you will get a decent grade. Loved him!

He doesn't respond to emails the first time. He grades very picky and inconsistent. I normally got a 70 or 100 on the labs; rarely in between, even though I put in the maximum amount of effort for all labs. He also doesn't give partial credit and cannot give you a clear explanation on why you missed something. Definitely would not take again.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: He's a down to earth guy that knows his stuff. Be careful when writing reports, though. Be as clear and to the point as possible, pointless fluff could knock you down a couple points. The labs this year in particular were horribly organized, but even so his pre-labs cleared everything up and got rid of a lot of confusion with the lab instructions.

He doesn't know the content of his classes, grades inconsistently without using the provided course answer key. Overall, one of the worst teachers I have ever had. Top worst if considering only KSU faculty.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Can not stand this guy. He is a horrible professor. DO NOT TAKE!!! Maybe he'll have so low of people taking his class, KSU will get rid of him. Does not deserve to be teaching.

He is not an easy A. I suspect he didn't really know what he was talking about in some labs. He will kick you out if you are doing a lab wrong. He is ok. He can be very mean. If I had to I would take him again, but not willingly. Also, he doesn't know what is on the final. So you are basically on your own.

Mr. Hidalgo is a tough grader, as mentioned in another review. Does not give partial credit! Also, he is a bias grader. For example, my lab partner and I would have the EXACT same answers for some labs and he gave me a lower grade than my partner. Overall, he's a cool guy, but i've heard they're much easier and better  lab instructors out there.

This is a tough lab (chem2) and he is a hard grader. But, if you want to work hard, come prepared, and dressed appropriately he is a great teacher.  I really enjoyed this lab.  He is a very personable guy, and will answer any questions you have.

This guy is a jerk. Not helpful what so ever and his head is completely stuck up his own butt. If you do the lab wrong, he kicks you out "to teach you a lesson" and will give you a zero. If you're not prepared, he sends you home. If you do a part of the lab report wrong he'll give you a zero. Laughed when tons of people dropped the class.

Mr. Hidalgo is one of the better profs I've had. He doesn't want to waste anyone's time so he works to get everyone in and out ASAP. He doesn't like slackers and will send you home, so dress properly, DO YOUR NOTEBOOK, and do the experiments correctly. Overall extremely laid back individual who wants you to pass and will help you. Very nice guy

Hidalgo was a great professor, doesn't like slackers and will help as much as he can to get us in and out the door as fast as possible while still knowing what happened. As long as you do the math during labs and dont let your partner do it all the final is super easy review of math done basically. Cannot float on your partner the whole semester.

Weekly lab quizzes online, you have to hand write each lab in a nonspiral notebook BEFORE each lab if you dont have it finished you dont get to do the lab, nor allowed to turn in that weeks lab report even if your lab partner gave his notes to you The final is all about the labs, so keep ALL labs and study them hard Labs only take an hour to write

Professor Hidalgo is helpful and clear cut in my opinion. His labs are straight forward, and he really emphasizes to use good science skills in lab. He does not allow for slackers, so if you don't do your pre-lab you'll be out the door in a minute. I enjoyed having him as a teacher and passed with an A-.

The Class is pretty easy, but there is a lot of prework that goes into it, but it is pretty easy and he is an easy grader a lab quiz every week.  I dont know why the other reviews got a bad experience but trust me he is an easy professor for  Chem lab 1. The textbook for lab is mandatory to have.

Very easy lab instructor. Gives a short pre-lab lecture before each lab. A lot of work required before the lab such as the quiz and notebook, but other than that, a very easy course. Very helpful when asked questions. Not sure what happened to the other reviewers, but trust me, he is a good professor.

Easy A if you do the pre work. Online quizzes every week from the lab manual, but very easy. You get three tries and only the highest one counts. Overall he's very helpful, but you have to do all of the work yourself.
Isn't helpful. Doesn't even know the answers himself. Does not reply to emails. Does not work with you to get a good grade.
Not sure what happened to the other guy who review him. Lab is pretty easy and Hidalgo is a nice guy and helps. Easy grader too. One lab our experiment did not work, yet we still received a 100.

Awful. Do not take. HE showed up for lab one day and didn't know what lab we were doing. He runs late every day. Does not know the material, is no help grades hard is not clear on what he expects, and did not prepare us for the final at all.
